explanation: The report is correct. strncpy(ldev->dev_name, dev_name, sizeof(ldev->dev_name) - 1) will attempt to read up to sizeof(ldev->dev_name)-1 bytes from dev_name. The code does not ensure that dev_name points to a NUL-terminated array of at least that size (there is no prior length/check on dev_name). That means, if dev_name is shorter than that or not NUL-terminated within that range, strncpy can read past the bounds of the object referenced by dev_name, violating MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. (Note: the preceding memset zeroes the destination so the destination will be NUL-terminated, but this does not prevent out-of-bounds reads from the source.)
